div.small: Disclaimer: Olivet Community Schools is not responsible for and does not endorse or guarantee the content of any links outside of the olivetschools.org site. Links to other sites have been provided to us for your information, education and convenience only.

h3.div: REGULAR BOARD MEETING: 5/11/20 @ 7:00PM - This meeting will stream via Google Meet.
Finance Committee Meeting: 4/27/20 @ 1:00 PM - Held via Google Meet
4-20-20 OLIVET DISTANCE LEARNING PLAN BEGINS FOR STUDENTS

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.a: SUPERINTENDENT SEARCH: Superintendent of Schools Position Announcement

div.p: Every Monday through the end of the school year, parents can drive in and pick up an entire week of FREE breakfasts and FREE lunches at the Olivet Middle School Cafeteria entrance between 9:00 11:00 a.m., or until all lunches have been distributed.
This is FREE for all children 18 years and younger.
This is not limited to Olivet students.
Olivet Community Schools invites you to participate in this Request for Proposal (RFP) for District Transportation Services.

The Olivet Community Schools Board of Education reserves the right to accept or reject any and/or all proposals or to accept the proposal that it finds, in its sole discretion, to be in the best interest of the school district.

All proposals must be submitted no later than 12:00 noon on May 1, 2020, in a sealed envelope addressed to Olivet Community Schools and be clearly marked: District Transportation Services Proposal. Olivet Community Schools will not consider or accept a proposal received after the specified date and time for Proposal submission.

h2.div: Olivet Community Schools Outscores All Eaton, Calhoun, Branch and Barry County Districts in 3rd-8th Grade 2019 MSTEP Scores in ELA and Math

p.strong: The numbers from the Spring 2019 MSTEP testing are in, and our hardworking teachers and students have a lot to be proud of!

div.p: Olivet Community Schools would like to invite students, staff, parents and community members to become involved in our newly forming PR Committee. This group of people will work with experienced marketers to develop a campaign to promote Olivet Community Schools. We have so much to be proud of and are excited to share our accomplishments and opportunities! This committee will meet on a monthly basis beginning in November. Click here for more information.

If you apply funds to your student's food service account through RevTrak, you may have noticed that a service fee is now being charged. This service fee of $1.50 is to help offset the transaction fees RevTrak charges for the use of this service.
The service fee is "per transaction," so if you are applying funds to multiple student accounts at the same time you would only be assessed one service charge.

p.strong: Olivet Schools has switched from Remind to SchoolMessenger for sending alerts regarding school closing, delays, and emergencies. You may have signed up for Remind previously by texting the code we shared for enrollment. With the new SchoolMessenger system you will need to fill out our SchoolMessenger Enrollment Form if you are not a guardian or the first emergency contact of an active student.
Please fill out the form if:

div.p: -You are not Guardian 1 or Guardian 2 or the emergency contact of an active student in our Skyward system.
-Your supervisor has asked you to sign up for text alerts from the district.
-You are a daycare, grandparent or other who has an interest in school delays, closings or emergencies but is not a guardian or emergency contact of an active student.

We will be uploading the information we collect beginning on Friday, September 13, 2019 and daily afterward as needed. Once you are in the system you will get an "opt-in" text message which you will need to reply to with a Y. Your cell phone text messages charges will apply to these messages which is what you are agreeing to by replying Y to the opt-in text.
Olivet Community Schools is in need of individuals to fill-in for staff illnesses and/or for professional development times.

OCS hires our substitute staff teachers and substitute parapro's through EduStaff.org . If you think you might be interested, check it out. Begin your application on-line, attend an orientation meeting and you will be ready to work!
Sign-up today! If questions, call Stacey at 269-749-9129.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

h2.div: OMS STEM Helps Local Medical Staff

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: "The shortage of PPE for our medical staff and hospitals has created a need for businesses and individuals to help supply doctors and nurses with the necessary safety equipment. The Olivet Middle School STEM Department has been working to support medical staff in our local hospitals. Using 3D printers and plastic transparencies, Olivet Middle School is creating face shields. To date, we have delivered 300 face shields to Oaklawn Hospital and are looking to produce more in the coming weeks. This work is directly tied to what students are taught during STEM classes. They learn about 3D printing in the context of real world problems and helping create solutions. Olivet Middle School is proud to support our local medical staff remain safe as they work to fight COVID-19."
